data.title: Anna Maria Island weather and climate
data.meta_description: Anna Maria Island, located in the United States of America, boasts a tropical climate distinguished by warm temperatures year-round. Daytime temperatures range from approximately 21.40 degrees in the chillier months to a peak of 32.80 degrees during the height of summer. Swimmers and snorkelers enjoy a sea that warms to 29.87 degrees in the hottest month and cools to a still-pleasant 18.34 degrees in the coldest month. The soothing nighttime temperatures dip to about 10.50 degrees in the winter and only rise to a balmy 23.60 degrees in the summer. While generally a dry place, Anna Maria Island experiences its lowest precipitation in April with just 4.17 days of rain, but sees a significant increase to 15.62 days in the rainy month of August.
data.text:
Weather overview

Anna Maria Island, located in the United States of America, boasts a tropical climate distinguished by warm temperatures year-round. Daytime temperatures range from approximately 21.40 degrees in the chillier months to a peak of 32.80 degrees during the height of summer. Swimmers and snorkelers enjoy a sea that warms to 29.87 degrees in the hottest month and cools to a still-pleasant 18.34 degrees in the coldest month. The soothing nighttime temperatures dip to about 10.50 degrees in the winter and only rise to a balmy 23.60 degrees in the summer. While generally a dry place, Anna Maria Island experiences its lowest precipitation in April with just 4.17 days of rain, but sees a significant increase to 15.62 days in the rainy month of August.

January weather

Sea temperatures in Anna Maria Island have diminished to 18.68 degrees, coinciding with the year's lowest daytime temperature of 21.40 degrees. An upward trend in rainy days starts with the count being 6.45 days. The night temperature is also at its coldest for the year.

February weather

With the advent of warmer weather, the daytime temperature in Anna Maria Island increases to 22.40 degrees. In contrast, the sea temperature registers its coldest at 18.34 degrees. There is a persistent increase in rainy days up to 6.97, while the quantity of rainfall also begins to escalate. Night temperatures see a rise to 11.80 degrees, and the number of sunny hours takes an upward turn with an average of 7.22 hours of clear skies.

March weather

In Anna Maria Island, sea temperatures exhibit an upward trend to 19.83 degrees, while the ascending pattern in daytime temperatures continues, now reaching 24.60 degrees. The number of rainy days starts a downward shift, but there's an observable increase in precipitation volume reaching 86.40 millimeters. The night warms up further to 14.10 degrees, and wind speeds hit their peak at 4.40 meters per second.

April weather

April ushers in further warmth, with daytime temperatures climbing to 27.10 degrees in Anna Maria Island, and the sea temperature also riding a similar upswing to 22.49 degrees. The island experiences the fewest rainy days of the year, at 4.17, along with the least rainfall at 48.64 millimeters. Night times continue to warm with a measurement of 16.40 degrees, and sun hours reach an impressive 9.94 hours, reflecting longer periods of unobstructed sunshine.

May weather

Commencing the tourist season, May in Anna Maria Island is marked by a continued boost in daytime temperatures, now at 30.40 degrees, and a sea temperature that has warmed correspondingly to 25.59 degrees. An increment in rainy days to 6.61 is noted, as well as an elevation in rainfall volume to 61.86 millimeters. Maximum sun hours occur, heralding abundant sunshine.

June weather

The burgeoning tourist season in Anna Maria Island is accompanied by rising daytime temperatures, with the sea temperature increasing similarly to the previous month to 28.13 degrees. The increment in both the number of rainy days, now at 12.05, and the volume of rainfall, reaching 186.34 millimeters, becomes more noticeable. A continued surge in night temperature to 22.50 degrees is apparent.

July weather

July in Anna Maria Island showcases soaring daytime temperatures peaking at 32.60 degrees, with sea temperature on a similar upward trajectory at 29.51 degrees. Rainy days are on the rise, tallying at 13.67, with the quantity of rainfall remaining considerable at 192.59 millimeters. As the wet season looms, the decline in sun hours is noticeable, now averaging 8.58 hours.

August weather

August in Anna Maria Island experiences the year's highest daytime temperature of 32.80 degrees, and sea temperature is equally impressive at its peak of 29.87 degrees. The wet season is in full effect, evident from the maximum number of rainy days at 15.62 and the peak rainfall amount of 231.28 millimeters. Night temperatures remain at their summertime high of 23.60 degrees.

September weather

As tourist activity begins to wind down in September, Anna Maria Island observes a gentle decline in daytime temperature to 31.80 degrees. A corresponding decrease in sea temperature to 29.04 degrees is registered, alongside a dip in rainfall to 186.51 millimeters and a decrease in rainy days. Nighttime temperatures initiate a descent, standing at 23.00 degrees.

October weather

During October in Anna Maria Island, the continuity of the declining daytime temperature is evident, currently at 29.30 degrees, alongside the sea temperature's descent to 26.64 degrees. Rainfall continues on a downward trend with a volume of 65.95 millimeters, and the number of rainy days likewise decreases to 6.70. Night temperatures slide to a milder 19.80 degrees.

November weather

November brings a continued decrease in daytime temperatures in Anna Maria Island, which stand at 25.70 degrees, while the sea temperature also observes a fall to 23.20 degrees. A further reduction in the number of rainy days is noted, with only 5.69 registered, and rainfall volumes also see a decline. Night temperatures drop to a cooler 15.60 degrees, and the number of sunny hours sees the start of a descent, registered at 6.79 hours.

December weather

In December, Anna Maria Island observes a further decline in daytime temperature to 22.60 degrees, with sea temperatures decreasing as well, mirroring the previous month at 20.65 degrees. An increase in rainfall amount is noticeable at 58.93 millimeters, while night temperatures continue their downward trajectory to 12.10 degrees. The sunshine hours reach their annual low, and the shortest day lengths are recorded with an average of 10.27 hours.
